findings.description: disinvest(): burns balance but does not decrease totalSupply
findings.reasoning: This finding meets all BONUS_VALID criteria: 1) Concrete exploit steps are provided showing how an attacker could inflate totalSupply and trap dividend Ether; 2) No trusted role compromise is required; 3) There is no existing mitigation for this issue; 4) The vulnerability is in the analyzed contract; 5) This is clearly an unintentional flaw; 6) It has material impact by causing permanent dilution of dividend payouts.

findings.description: disinvest() + payWallet(): walletBalance not increased before subtraction
findings.reasoning: This finding meets all BONUS_VALID criteria: 1) Concrete exploit steps are provided showing how an attacker could cause an underflow and break coldStore(); 2) No trusted role compromise is required; 3) There is no existing mitigation for this issue; 4) The vulnerability is in the analyzed contract; 5) This is clearly an unintentional flaw; 6) It has material impact by potentially causing a denial-of-service for treasury withdrawals.

target_assessment.type_match_reasoning: The target vulnerability (timestamp_dependency) was not mentioned in the analysis.

notes: The analysis provided two valid findings that meet the strict criteria for BONUS_VALID. However, it failed to identify the target vulnerability related to timestamp dependency and weak randomness.
